Ethnologue > Web version > Country index > Africa > Nigeria > Kanuri, Central

Kanuri, Central

A language of Nigeria

ISO 639-3: knc

Population  3,000,000 in Nigeria (Gunnemark and Kenrick 1985). Population total all countries: 3,240,500.
Region  Borno state, Kukawa, Kaga, Konduga, Maiduguri, Monguno, Ngala, Bama, Gwoza LGAs; Yobe state, Nguru, Geidam, Damaturu, Fika, Fune, and Gujba LGAs; Jigawa state, Hadejia LGA. Also in Cameroon, Chad, Eritrea, Niger, Sudan.
Language map  Nigeria, Map 4, reference number 218
Alternate names   Beriberi, Bornu, Kanouri, Kanoury, Yerwa Kanuri
Dialects  Kaga (Kagama), Lare (Lere), Kwayam, Njesko, Kabari (Kuvuri), Ngazar, Guvja, Mao, Temageri, Fadawa, Yerwa. Kwayam dialect not understood by other Kanuri (Lukas 1937). Maiduguri dialect mutually intelligible. Most similar to Manga Kanuri [kby] and Tumari Kanuri [krt]. Yerwa is the central dialect. Part of a dialect subgroup that includes other Kanuri dialects and Tumari Kanuri [krt] in Chad.
Classification  Nilo-Saharan, Saharan, Western, Kanuri
A member of macrolanguage Kanuri [kau] (Nigeria).
Language use  Official language. 500,000 L2 speakers.
Language development  Radio programs. TV. Dictionary. Grammar. NT: 1997.
Writing system  Arabic script, Ajami style. Latin script.
Comments  SOV. Muslim.

Also spoken in:

Cameroon

Language name   Kanuri, Central
Population  56,500 in Cameroon (1982 SIL).
Region  Far North Province, Mayo-Sava Division, mainly north of Mora between Limani and Bounderi, and Kolofata Subdivision; Diamare Division, Maroua and Bogo Subdivisions; Kaele and Mayo-Danay divisions, as far as Mindif and Guirvidig.
Language map  Northern Cameroon, reference number 12
Alternate names  “Baribari” , “Beriberi” , Bornouan, Bornouans, Bornu, Kanouri, Kanoury, Kole, Kolere, Sirata, Yerwa Kanuri
Dialects  Mowor (Movar), Dagara, Kaga (Kagama), Sugurti, Lare, Kwayam, Njesko, Kabari (Kuvuri), Ngazar, Guvja, Mao, Temageri, Fadawa, Maiduguri.
Comments  Muslim.
 

Chad

Language name   Kanuri, Central
Population  104,000 in Chad (2006). 34,549 in Chari-Baguirmi and 23,287 in N’Djaména.
Region  Communities in Chari-Baguirmi, Batha, Guéra, and Mayo-Kebbi regions.
Language map  Southwestern Chad, reference number 34
Alternate names  Aga, “Baribari” , “Beriberi” , Bornouan, Bornouans, Bornu, Kanouri, Kanoury, Kole, Kolere, Sirata, Yerwa Kanuri
Dialects  Dagara, Kaga (Kagama), Sugurti, Lare, Kwayam, Njesko, Kabari (Kuvuri), Ngazar, Guvja, Mao, Temageri, Fadawa.
Comments  Muslim.
 

Niger

Language name   Kanuri, Central
Population  80,000 in Niger (1998).
Region  East, along Nigeria border.
Language map  Niger
Alternate names  “Beriberi” , Bornouans, Bornu, Kanouri, Kanoury, Kole, Sirata, Yerwa Kanuri
Dialects  Movar (Mowor, Mober, Mobber, Mavar).
Comments  Movar may be a separate language. Muslim.
 

Sudan

Language name   Kanuri, Central
Region  North.
Alternate names  “Beriberi” , Bornouans, Bornu, Kanouri, Kanoury, Kole, Sirata, Yerwa Kanuri
Dialects  Dagara, Kaga (Kagama), Sugurti, Lare, Kwayam, Njesko, Kabari (Kuvuri), Ngazar, Guvja, Mao, Temageri, Fadawa, Maiduguri.

Academic Publications

Jarrett, K. A. 1980. "Tense/aspect/mood in Kanuri verb forms."

Jarrett, K. A. 1981. "The development of the Kanuri aspect system within Western Saharan."

Jarrett, Kevin A. 1988. "Dialectes et alphabétisation dans les écoles: Une étude explorative de l’intercompréhension des différents dialectes kanuri du Niger."
